intro: Terebinthina helferi, commonly known as the Helfer's terebinth, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clustered flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species. Its botanical features make it an important subject for ecological and conservation studies.
